result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety. th
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($1,000.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 05-11-2022

22RM023597  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/29/2022

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Gabriel Luis Heredia in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Benitez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Violation Report dated May 2, 2022 - received
Preliminary court notified
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving.

Defendant Gabriel Luis Heredia in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Gabriel Luis Heredia in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gabriel Luis Heredia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
